column5: Has anyone hooked into any crappie yet? I was just checking to see if anyone had any luck.

Yes, they are definitely on the feed. Just look for shallow areas that heat up the fastest.  My presentation is about 2 feet from the surface... they are still sluggish...so slow your presentation down and look for subtle hits.  Go get 'em while it's hot!

I tried Holland River last week with no success. However, I was only there for about an hour at most. The trip was mostly to test my new boat on water. But, while I was there, didn't see anyone else catch anything either  Which body of water were you at, frozen-fire?
Hit into a school of small stuff yesterday. I think the biggest was pushing 7"
nothing in my neck of the woods yet, not even a sunfish.  I am sure by the end of this weekend though, they will be on fire.
Me and a buddy had a good time tonight hauling them. It took a couple spots to find them, but once we did, it was non stop. Every cast.  s.
Went out last night for 1.5hrs and caught afew. Lots of bluegills and acouple herring to boot. Bigger ones should be in the next couple of days. Cheers Jeff
lets just say between 4 guys in my boat we had any where from 250 to just shy of 300.. through MANY of them back
